oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter written by a local store owner post-war in Jasper, Tenn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter written by a local store owner immediately post-war in Jasper, Tenn. It is addressed to "Victor" and written by "Edgefield." He writes about entering information into Dr. J.H. McLean's almanac for 1866 and selling a good many of his medicines. He goes on to discuss business in the area and the establishment of a post office. Connected to mari035
